description:
This PR is a set of changes intended to move toward a unified codebase for Python 2 and 3. 

Most of the changes involve the expected sorts of things, for example:

1. Changing `print` to be a function
2. `xrange` replaced by `range`
3. Turning dictionary views (e.g., `keys()`) into lists
4. `basestring` replaced by `string_types`

Note the change to setup.py where we *do not* run `2to3` on files--the goal is to have a single codebase without having to run `2to3`.

Also, previously we did not build any analysis modules when running setup with Python 3--this PR isolates the build restriction to `halo_finding`, which is temporary until we can figure out why it won't build. 

I've run the unittests (but not the answer tests) locally in Python 2 and they all pass. Most of the unittests pass with Python 3, but a handful (~20) are still failing. 

These changes should bring us a substantial way forward towards supporting 2 and 3 with a single codebase. Suggestions for better ways of doing this are most welcome. I most certainly haven't caught everything yet, either. 

I also fixed various whitespace and indentation problems. 

UPDATES: 

1. I found some issues I introduced with command-line options that were not caught by the tests.
2. I merged in @xarthisius's commits.
3. Made changes according to @ngoldbaum's suggestions.
title: Steps toward a unified Python 2/3 codebase

pullrequest.title: Steps toward a unified Python 2/3 codebase

content.raw:
Looking good, @jzuhone .

This doesn't have to be done for accepting this PR, but it might be good to have a small document somewhere that tells us developers/users who mostly use python 2.x what changes we should account for in making sure our code works with the new codebase.  I'm not asking for a big summary of the changes from python 2->3, but more just the small changes that you're applying in these PRs for updating to python 3.  I'm sort of envisioning something like this:

http://yt-project.org/docs/dev/yt3differences.html#converting-old-scripts-to-work-with-yt-3-0
content.html:

I'm sort of envisioning something like this:

http://yt-project.org/docs/dev/yt3differences.html#converting-old-scripts-to-work-with-yt-3-0
